thread.title: Iheanacho’ll fight for City spot, says dad
thread.title_full: Iheanacho’ll fight for City spot, says dad

author: Okogba
title: Iheanacho’ll fight for City spot, says dad
text:
Home » News » Iheanacho’ll fight for City spot, says dad Iheanacho’ll fight for City spot, says dad On 4:16 am In News by Okogba Comments 
AS Kelechi Iheanacho’s prospect for a starting team place seems to have evaporated at Manchester City, his father James Iheanacho has hinted that his son will not go on out loan to any other club. 
Iheanacho has seen little action under Pep Guardiola despite proving his mettle as a potent striker. The former Golden Eaglets star was left out of the squad in last weekend’s 2-2 draw against Tottenham at the Ethihad Stadium, following the arrival of Brazilian Gabriel Jesus. Iheanacho celebrating his goal against Southampton 
“Automatically Kelechi is not going on loan because his name is not among the players leaving, “ James Iheanacho told allnigeriasoccer. com. 
“It is only yesterday he did not play (or make the bench). “ 
Saturday’s tie against Spurs was the first time this season that Iheanacho did not make Man City’s match day squad for a Premier League game. Okogba
